thread.title: US man admits sending military technology to Russia
thread.title_full: US man admits sending military technology to Russia | News24

author: news24.com
title: US man admits sending military technology to Russia
text:
New York - A Texas man admitted on Wednesday in federal court in New York that he acted as a secret agent for the Russian government and headed an operation over about 10 years to export military technology to that country.
Alexander Fishenko, a naturalised US citizen and owner of Houston-based Arc Electronics Inc, pleaded guilty in US District Court in Brooklyn to numerous crimes, including money laundering, obstruction of justice and acting as an agent of the Russian government in the United States. A sentencing date hasn't been set.
Prosecutors say he headed a scheme to purposely evade strict export controls for cutting-edge microelectronics commonly used in missile guidance systems, detonation triggers and radar systems. The 49-year-old Fishenko, among 11 people charged in the case, "lined his pockets at the expense of our national security," Acting US Attorney Kelly Currie said in a statement.
Defense attorney Richard Levitt did not immediately respond to a message seeking comment.
